alert.note: Alert for Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 02 at 3:16PM CDT until September 03 at 10:22AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following county, Harris. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This may cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain may result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Memorial Park, Greater Heights, Afton Oaks / River Oaks Area, Neartown / Montrose, Fourth Ward, Near Northside Houston, Greenway / Upper Kirby Area, southwestern Northside / Northline, Midtown Houston, Downtown Houston, Lazybrook / Timbergrove, Central Northwest, Independence Heights, Spring Branch East, Greater Uptown, The Galleria, southern Acres Home, Langwood and Greater Inwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
